doc.after: Since the 1980s, the road and rail network of Greece has been significantly modernized. Important works include the A2 (Egnatia Odos) motorway, that connects northwestern Greece (Igoumenitsa) with northern and northeastern Greece (Kipoi); and the RioâAntirrio bridge, the longest suspension cable bridge in Europe (2,250Â m (7,382Â ft) long), connecting the Peloponnese from Rio (7Â km (4Â mi) from Patras) with Antirrio in Central Greece.
